name: Football for Dummies #8 Multiple Choice Quiz | Worldwide  Football | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following is Paul Gascoigne most famous for in England's 1990 World Cup semi-final game?
questions.correct: Booked, meaning he would miss the final if England progressed
options: Gave away a penalty, resulting in an England loss
He broke his foot
Played in every England game, but was dropped for the semi-final game
questions.explanation:
Booked, meaning he would miss the final if England progressed.

	'Gazza' was booked playing for England against Germany in 1990, which meant he would miss the final if England progressed. This did not happen, however, and Germany went on to beat Argentina, 1-0 with Andreas brehme scoring a penalty in the 85th minute. Gascoigne's incident was not isolated, as the same thing happened to France's Laurent Blanc in the 1998 World Cup semi-final game against Croatia. France went on to lift the trophy without their centre-back, as they beat a lack-lustre Brazil, 3-0.

questions.text: Which of these is Dino Zoff famous for?
questions.correct: Held aloft the World Cup at the age of 40 as Italy's captain
options: Became the first goalkeeper to be sent off in a World Cup final
Became the first goalkeeper to score a goal in the World Cup finals
First goalkeeper to be substituted in a World Cup final
questions.explanation:
Held aloft the World Cup at the age of 40 as Italy's captain.

	Zoff was regarded as one of the greatest goalkeepers to play in a World Cup final. In 1982, Zoff would lift the World Cup as the captain of Italy, and played for his country a total of 112 times.

questions.text: Kevin Moran is most famous for which of the following?
questions.correct: First man to be sent off in an FA Cup final
options: Scored the first penalty in an FA Cup final
He was sold, then bought back by the club just 3 days later
First man to play for Ireland and England
questions.explanation:
First man to be sent off in an FA Cup final.

	Moran was sent off in the 1985 FA Cup final while playing for Manchester United against Everton. United won the game 1-0, with a young Norman Whiteside scoring the winner.

questions.text: Which of these is Mike Newell famous for in a Champions League game?
questions.correct: Set the record for the fastest hat-trick
options: Scored a goal, then was sent off
Scored two own-goals
Punched the referee
questions.explanation:
Set the record for the fastest hat-trick.

	Newell's hat-trick came in a 1995 Champions League game for Blackburn Rovers against Rosenborg at Ewood Park. Blackburn won the game 4-1, with Alan Shearer opening the scoring with a penalty, followed by Newell's 9 minute hat-trick in the 31st, 37th, and 40th minutes.

questions.text: Which of these players did NOT gain notoriety by failing a drugs test?
options: Adrian Mutu
Jaap Stam
Diego Maradona
questions.explanation:
Rio Ferdinand.

	Ferdinand missed a drugs test but did not fail one, and was subsequently banned for eight months. Stam was given five months for use of Nandrolone, Maradona was banned for a year after testing positive for Ephedrine, and Mutu failed an unknown test in 2004.

questions.text: Ian Wright is most famous for beating Cliff bastin's Arsenal goalscoring record?
options: t
f
questions.explanation:
True.

	Wright scored 185 goals in total for Arsenal between 1991-98, beating Bastin's previous record of 178. During his career, Wright played for Crystal Palace, Arsenal, West Ham United, Nottingham Forest, Glasgow Celtic and Burnley.

questions.text: Which of these is Brian Clough most famous for?
questions.correct: Led Nottingham Forest to two successive European Cups
options: Led Leeds United to two successive FA Cups
Led Derby County to two successive League titles
Led Brighton from the old 4th Division to top flight football
questions.explanation:
Led Nottingham Forest to two successive European Cups.

	Brian Clough died in 2004, after a long and illustrious career. Clough scored 251 goals in 274 games as a player, and as a manager, he won the European Cup with Forest in 1979 and 1980. Clough is widely regarded as the greatest manager England never had.

questions.text: Which of these is Gary Lineker most famous for?
questions.correct: He was never booked or sent off in a professional game
options: Scored an hat-trick on his England debut
Set a record of 48 goals for England
Captained England in every game he played
questions.explanation:
He was never booked or sent off in a professional game.

	While Lineker did score 48 goals for England, he fell one short of the record set by Sir Bobby Charlton. Lineker played 80 times for his country, and played for Leicester City, Everton, Barcelona, Tottenham Hotspur, and Grampus Eight during his career.

questions.text: Which of the following is Jean-marc Bosman most famous for?
questions.correct: He effectively created the free trade of players within Europe
options: He was sent off three times in a row
Scored 5 times in 30 minutes of a League game
Played and managed his national team
questions.explanation:
He effectively created the free trade of players within Europe.

	The Bosman Ruling as it became known, was born in 1995, when Bosman wanted to transfer clubs after his contract had expired. RFC Liege refused to let the player go without a suitable fee, which led to Bosman taking the club to the European Court of Justice. Players can now change clubs at the end of their contracts without a transfer fee, because to the ruling.

questions.text: Eric Cantona is most famous for attacking a Swindon Town supporter, after the Frenchman had been sent off.
options: t
f
questions.explanation:
False.

	It was a Crystal Palace supporter than Cantona launched into, kung-fu style in 1995. He was snapped up by Manchester United for a bargain fee in 1992, and led the club to their first championship in 26 years. Cantona retired from the game in 1997, after winning 4 League titles with United.
